footer.tagline: SV2 mining gateway infrastructure for production pool operators.
cta.ready: Ready to deploy SV2 with confidence?
cta.sub: Shadow mode costs nothing. Observe mode builds trust. Inline mode protects revenue.
home.hero.label: Stratum V2 Infrastructure
home.hero.title:
SV2 mining gateway
built for production pools
home.hero.sub: ReserveGrid OS is a miner-facing Stratum V2 gateway with Noise NX encrypted transport, template verification, fail-closed prevhash switching, and a two-event share lifecycle. Every decision carries a machine-readable reason code.
home.problem.title:
SV2 enables miner autonomy.
That autonomy needs guardrails.
home.problem.sv2_body: Stratum V2 lets miners propose their own block templates. Pools gain encrypted transport and reduced bandwidth, but lose visibility into what miners submit. Without verification, a pool has no way to detect malformed templates, fee policy violations, or stale prevhash references before distributing work.
home.problem.rg_body: ReserveGrid OS sits between miners and the pool as a standard job server. It verifies every template against operator policy, switches prevhash references with fail-closed safety, tracks shares through a two-event lifecycle, and emits structured reason codes for every decision.
home.arch.title: End-to-end gateway flow
home.arch.sub: From miner handshake to upstream share submission, every hop is observable.
home.arch.callout: The gateway also forwards valid shares upstream via HTTP POST to the pool backend. Shares flow through a bounded queue with configurable backpressure policy.
home.cap.title: What the gateway handles
home.cap.modes_body: Shadow audits templates without miners. Observe logs verdicts without gating. Inline enforces policy with fail-closed safety. One binary, one config key.
home.cap.share_body: Every share produces share_accepted at ACK time and share_forward_result after upstream POST. Joined by share_id with a 1:1 invariant.
home.cap.prevhash_body: When a new block arrives, miners hold on stale work until the verifier responds. 50ms verdict timeout, 5s stale hold, deterministic disconnect on expiry.
home.cmp.title: What changes with ReserveGrid
home.out.title: What operators see
home.out.sub: Every verdict is structured, machine-readable, and carries the policy context that caused it.
p404.sub: This route returned no match. The page you requested does not exist or has been moved.
about.hero.label: About Veldra
about.hero.title: Mining infrastructure for the next era
about.hero.sub: We build the systems that enable miners and pools to operate SV2 with confidence.
about.who.title: A team focused on mining operator infrastructure
about.mission.title: Our mission
about.mission.body: To provide production-grade, policy-driven SV2 gateway infrastructure that operators can deploy with confidence. We believe in observable systems, machine-readable decisions, and fail-closed safety.
about.approach.title: Our approach
about.approach.body: Every feature in ReserveGrid OS is driven by operator feedback. We prioritize transparency, configurability, and operational safety. One binary, multiple deployment modes, and reason codes for every decision.
about.product.title: ReserveGrid OS
about.product.sub: A Stratum V2 mining gateway built for production pool operators.
about.tech.title: The ReserveGrid stack
about.tech.gateway_desc: Miner-facing SV2 endpoint with Noise NX encrypted transport and dynamic job distribution.
about.tech.verifier_desc: Template verification engine with 34 reason codes and policy-driven decision logic.
about.tech.tmgr_desc: Block template poller and router with prevhash tracking and fail-closed switching.
about.tech.protocol_desc: Stratum V2 with Noise NX encryption, custom extensions for reason codes, and structured event streams.
about.eng.title: Built on proven systems
about.eng.p1_body: Memory safety and fearless concurrency. No garbage collection, no surprises at 3 AM.
about.eng.p2_body: Each component is independently testable and deployable. Architecture follows operator workflow.
about.eng.p3_body: Every decision is logged with context. Prometheus metrics, event streams, and Grafana dashboards built in.
about.eng.p4_body: When in doubt, the gateway rejects work. Deterministic timeouts, bounded queues, and clear policy enforcement.
about.eng.p5_body: 51 TOML keys plus environment variable overrides. No runtime GUI, no magic defaults.
about.eng.p6_body: Every rejection carries machine-readable context. Operators see why, when, and under which policy.
about.contact.title: Have questions about ReserveGrid?
product.hero.label: Product
product.hero.title: Confidence through configuration
product.hero.sub: ReserveGrid OS is a policy-driven SV2 gateway. Configure your requirements, deploy your way, observe the results.
product.modes.title: Three ways to deploy
product.modes.shadow.title: Shadow Mode
product.modes.shadow.use: Use case: Learning, proof of concept
product.modes.observe.title: Observe Mode
product.modes.observe.desc: Log verdicts, forward all shares upstream
product.modes.observe.use: Use case: Build operator trust, gradual adoption
product.modes.inline.title: Inline Mode
product.features.title: Built for operators
product.f1.title: Noise NX encryption
product.f1.desc: Industry-standard elliptic curve transport. Miners encrypt their payloads; pools decrypt with a fixed key.
product.f2.title: 34 reason codes
product.f2.desc: Every rejection is machine-readable. Operators know why work was rejected and under which policy context.
product.f3.title: Fail-closed prevhash
product.f3.desc: 50ms verdict timeout. 5s stale work hold. Miners disconnected deterministically on expiry.
product.f4.title: Two-event lifecycle
product.f4.desc: share_accepted at ACK time, share_forward_result after upstream POST. Joined by share_id with 1:1 invariant.
product.f5.title: Configurable backpressure
product.f5.desc: Bounded share queue with policy-driven overflow behavior. Protect pool infrastructure from downstream storms.
product.f6.title: Observability
product.f6.desc: Prometheus metrics, structured event logs, and Grafana dashboards. See every decision in real time.
product.config.title: 51 TOML keys, zero magic
product.config.intro: ReserveGrid OS is configured via TOML with environment variable overrides. No defaults hide pool behavior.
product.security.title: Operator first
product.security.c1.title: Encrypted transport
product.security.c1.desc: Noise NX with fixed keys. No certificate infrastructure, no external dependencies.
product.security.c2.title: Fail-closed logic
product.security.c2.desc: Timeouts are deterministic. Stale work is held. Invalid templates trigger rejections with reason codes.
product.security.c3.title: Auditability
product.security.c3.desc: Every event is logged with context. Operators can reconstruct decisions offline.
product.demo.title: Try it now
product.demo.desc: Experience ReserveGrid OS in observe mode with a live SV2 testnet.

docs.hero.sub: Configuration, deployment, and operational guides for production SV2 mining infrastructure.

observe.hero.title: Gateway monitoring dashboard
observe.hero.sub: Live share events, gateway metrics, reason code analytics, and policy state. Real-time insights into your SV2 deployment performance and health.
observe.auth.title: Gateway Authentication
observe.arch.title: Architecture
observe.arch.desc: The gateway emits structured events for every share decision. This dashboard subscribes to those events in real time.
observe.tech.title: Technology
observe.tech.events_desc: Every share generates machine-readable events with reason codes and policy context.
observe.tech.metrics_desc: Standard metrics exported on /metrics endpoint. Integrate with Grafana for long-term trends.
observe.tech.logs_desc: JSON event logs for offline analysis and audit trails.
observe.verdicts.title: Verdict Catalog
legal.privacy.title: Privacy Policy
legal.privacy.s1.title: 1. Who we are
legal.privacy.s1.body: Veldra, Inc. ("Veldra", "we", "us") operates the veldra.org website and the ReserveGrid OS software suite. This policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your information when you interact with our services.
legal.privacy.s2.title: 2. Information we collect
legal.privacy.s2_1.title: 2.1 Account information
legal.privacy.s2_1.body: When you register for observe mode access, we collect your name, email address, organization name, and a password. Your password is stored as a one-way cryptographic hash using Argon2id. We never store or have access to your plaintext password.
legal.privacy.s2_2.title: 2.2 Session data
legal.privacy.s2_2.body: When you log in, we create a session token stored in your browser. Session tokens expire after 7 days by default. We store session metadata (creation time, last activity) to manage active sessions.
legal.privacy.s2_3.title: 2.3 Analytics
legal.privacy.s2_3.body: We may use third-party analytics services to understand how visitors use our website. These services may collect standard web analytics data including page views, referrer URLs, browser type, and approximate geographic location derived from IP address. We do not sell or share analytics data with third parties for advertising purposes.
legal.privacy.s2_4.title: 2.4 Operational data
legal.privacy.s2_4.body: ReserveGrid OS processes block template data as part of its verification function. Template data (block height, transaction counts, fee totals, and consensus fields) is logged locally on operator infrastructure. Veldra does not transmit, collect, or store operator template data on our servers.
legal.privacy.s3.title: 3. How we use your information
legal.privacy.s3.body: We use collected information to provide and maintain observe mode access, send email verification and account approval notifications, communicate about service updates or security issues, and improve the website experience through analytics.
legal.privacy.s4.title: 4. Data sharing
legal.privacy.s4.body: We do not sell your personal information. We may share information with email service providers (for transactional emails such as verification and approval notifications) and analytics providers (for aggregated, non-identifying usage data). We may also disclose information if required by law or to protect the rights and safety of Veldra and its users.
legal.privacy.s5.title: 5. Data retention
legal.privacy.s5.body: Account data is retained for as long as your account is active. Expired session tokens are automatically cleaned up. You may request account deletion by contacting us at jarrondeng@veldra.org.
legal.privacy.s6.title: 6. Security
legal.privacy.s6.body: We use industry-standard security measures including Argon2id password hashing, TLS encryption for data in transit, and access controls on our infrastructure. No system is perfectly secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security of your data.
legal.privacy.s7.title: 7. Your rights
legal.privacy.s7.body: You may request access to the personal data we hold about you, request correction of inaccurate data, request deletion of your account and associated data, or opt out of non-essential communications. To exercise these rights, contact us at jarrondeng@veldra.org.
legal.privacy.s8.title: 8. Cookies
legal.privacy.s8.body: We use a session cookie for authentication when you log into observe mode. We may use analytics cookies if third-party analytics are enabled. We do not use advertising or tracking cookies.
legal.privacy.s9.title: 9. Changes to this policy
legal.privacy.s9.body: We may update this policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised policy.
legal.privacy.s10.title: 10. Contact
legal.privacy.s10.body: For privacy-related inquiries, contact us at jarrondeng@veldra.org.
legal.terms.title: Terms of Service
legal.terms.s1.title: 1. Acceptance of terms
legal.terms.s1.body: By accessing or using veldra.org, the observe mode dashboard, or any Veldra software (collectively, the "Services"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, do not use the Services.
legal.terms.s2.title: 2. Description of services
legal.terms.s2.body: Veldra provides ReserveGrid OS, a policy-driven verification and observability layer for Bitcoin mining pool block templates. The Services include the public website, the observe mode dashboard, and the open-source software components (pool-verifier, template-manager, rg-protocol, sv2-bridge, rg-auth).
legal.terms.s3.title: 3. Eligibility
legal.terms.s3.body: You must be at least 18 years old to use the Services. By registering for an account, you represent that the information you provide is accurate and complete.
legal.terms.s4.title: 4. Account responsibilities
legal.terms.s4.body: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials. You agree to notify us promptly at jarrondeng@veldra.org if you become aware of any unauthorized use of your account. Veldra is not liable for losses arising from unauthorized access to your account.
legal.terms.s5.title: 5. Acceptable use
legal.terms.s5.body: You agree not to use the Services to violate any applicable law or regulation, attempt to gain unauthorized access to Veldra systems or other users' accounts, interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of the Services, reverse engineer or attempt to extract source code from proprietary components, or use the Services to conduct any form of market manipulation or fraudulent activity.
legal.terms.s6.title: 6. Observe mode access
legal.terms.s6.body: Access to the observe mode dashboard requires registration and approval by a Veldra administrator. Approval is at our sole discretion. We reserve the right to revoke access at any time, with or without cause. Observe mode displays operational data from connected ReserveGrid OS instances and is provided for informational and evaluation purposes only.
legal.terms.s7.title: 7. Software license
legal.terms.s7.body: ReserveGrid OS software components are provided under the terms of their respective licenses as specified in each component's repository. Use of the software is subject to those license terms in addition to these Terms of Service.
legal.terms.s8.title: 8. Intellectual property
legal.terms.s8.body: The Veldra name, logo, and the ReserveGrid OS brand are the property of Veldra, Inc. The website design, content, and documentation are protected by applicable intellectual property laws. You may not use our trademarks without prior written permission.
legal.terms.s9.title: 9. Limitation of liability
legal.terms.s9.body: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Veldra and its officers, directors, employees, and agents shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including but not limited to loss of profits, data, mining revenue, or business opportunity, arising from your use of or inability to use the Services, regardless of the theory of liability.
legal.terms.s10.title: 10. Disclaimer of warranties
legal.terms.s10.body: The Services are provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, whether express or implied. Veldra does not warrant that the Services will be uninterrupted, error-free, or free of harmful components. See our Disclaimer for additional details.
legal.terms.s11.title: 11. Indemnification
legal.terms.s11.body: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Veldra, Inc. and its affiliates from any claims, damages, losses, or expenses (including reasonable legal fees) arising from your use of the Services or your violation of these Terms.
legal.terms.s12.title: 12. Termination
legal.terms.s12.body: We may suspend or terminate your access to the Services at any time for any reason, including violation of these Terms. Upon termination, your right to use the Services ceases immediately. Provisions that by their nature should survive termination (including limitations of liability and indemnification) shall survive.
legal.terms.s13.title: 13. Modifications
legal.terms.s13.body: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date. Continued use of the Services after modifications constitutes acceptance of the revised Terms.
legal.terms.s14.title: 14. Governing law
legal.terms.s14.body: These Terms are governed by the laws of the State of Delaware, United States, without regard to conflict of law principles. Any disputes arising from these Terms shall be resolved in the courts located in the State of Delaware.
legal.terms.s15.title: 15. Contact
legal.terms.s15.body: For questions about these Terms, contact us at jarrondeng@veldra.org.
legal.disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
legal.disclaimer.s1.title: Software provided "as is"
legal.disclaimer.s1.body: ReserveGrid OS and all associated software components are provided "as is" and "as available" without warranty of any kind, whether express, implied, or statutory. Veldra, Inc. specifically disclaims all implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement.
legal.disclaimer.s2.title: Not financial or investment advice
legal.disclaimer.s2.body: ReserveGrid OS is a technical verification tool for block template policy evaluation. Nothing in the software, documentation, website, or observe mode dashboard constitutes financial advice, investment advice, trading advice, or any other form of professional financial guidance. Template verdicts (accept/reject) reflect operator-configured policy rules applied to technical block data. They are not recommendations to mine, not mine, buy, sell, or hold any asset.
legal.disclaimer.s3.title: Mining risk acknowledgment
legal.disclaimer.s3.body: Bitcoin mining involves inherent technical and financial risks. By using ReserveGrid OS, you acknowledge that template verification is one component of a mining operation and does not guarantee profitability, block production, or revenue. Rejected templates may result in miners receiving no work assignments, which reduces hash utilization. Accepted templates may still produce blocks that the Bitcoin network rejects for reasons outside the scope of policy evaluation (network forks, competing blocks, consensus rule changes).
legal.disclaimer.s4.title: No guarantee of correctness
legal.disclaimer.s4.body: While ReserveGrid OS is designed for deterministic, reproducible evaluation, Veldra does not guarantee that the software is free from bugs, errors, or vulnerabilities. Policy configuration errors, software defects, or unexpected interactions with upstream systems (bitcoind, Stratum V2 servers, mempool data sources) may cause incorrect verdicts. Operators are responsible for testing their policy configuration and monitoring verdict outcomes.
legal.disclaimer.s5.title: Consensus safety checks
legal.disclaimer.s5.body: The consensus safety features (weight ratio, template age, sigops budget, coinbase sigops) are informational checks based on known Bitcoin consensus constants. They do not replace full consensus validation performed by Bitcoin Core or equivalent full node software. A template that passes all ReserveGrid OS safety checks may still be invalid under Bitcoin consensus rules.
legal.disclaimer.s6.title: Limitation of liability
legal.disclaimer.s6.body: To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, Veldra, Inc. and its officers, directors, employees, and agents shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from the use of or inability to use the software, including but not limited to lost mining revenue, missed blocks, orphaned blocks, incorrect template verdicts, policy misconfiguration, data loss, or service interruption.
legal.disclaimer.s7.title: Operator responsibility
legal.disclaimer.s7.body: Operators deploying ReserveGrid OS in production are solely responsible for securing the deployment environment (network access, TLS, authentication), configuring policy rules appropriate for their operation, monitoring verdict logs and system health, maintaining backups and disaster recovery procedures, and complying with all applicable laws and regulations in their jurisdiction.
legal.disclaimer.s8.title: Third-party dependencies
legal.disclaimer.s8.body: ReserveGrid OS depends on third-party software components (Rust crates, operating system libraries, Bitcoin Core RPC). Veldra does not guarantee the security, availability, or correctness of third-party dependencies. Operators should review dependency licenses and security advisories independently.
legal.disclaimer.s9.title: Observe mode data
legal.disclaimer.s9.body: Data displayed in the observe mode dashboard is provided for informational and evaluation purposes only. Dashboard metrics, charts, and verdicts reflect real-time or simulated data depending on the connection state. Veldra makes no representation about the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of data displayed in observe mode.
legal.disclaimer.s10.title: Changes to this disclaimer
legal.disclaimer.s10.body: We may update this disclaimer from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date. Continued use of the software or Services after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised disclaimer.
legal.disclaimer.s11.title: Contact
legal.disclaimer.s11.body: For questions about this disclaimer, contact us at jarrondeng@veldra.org.
legal.translation_banner: This page has been automatically translated. The English version is the legally binding document.
observe.hero.label: Observe Mode
observe.auth.login_sub: Access live template verdicts and rejection analytics.
observe.auth.register_sub: Submit your info for admin review. You'll receive an email when approved.
observe.tiers.title: Mempool-driven fee tier distribution
observe.tiers.sub: Templates are evaluated against dynamic fee thresholds based on current mempool conditions.
observe.arch.sys_sub: ReserveGrid OS sits between the Bitcoin node and the pool, verifying every block template against operator-defined policy.
observe.catalog.title: Verdict reason code catalog
observe.catalog.sub: Every rejection carries a canonical, machine-readable reason_code. These codes are stable across protocol, verifier, exports, and documentation.
observe.flow.title: Template verification flow
docs.gw.noise_handshake_failed: Noise NX handshake did not complete (crypto failure or incompatible params)
docs.gw.unsupported_protocol_version: Miner offered unsupported SV2 protocol version
docs.gw.connection_rate_limited: Inbound connections exceeded per-IP rate limit
docs.gw.frame_decode_error: SV2 binary frame could not be decoded
docs.gw.internal_framing_error: Internal NDJSON message could not be parsed
docs.gw.miner_unauthorized: Worker identity not in allowlist and no prefix match
docs.gw.identity_prefix_unmatched: Worker identity did not match any prefix_map entry
docs.gw.invalid_channel_id: Share referenced a channel_id not assigned to this connection
docs.gw.extended_channel_unsupported: Miner requested extended channel (V1.0.0 supports standard only)
docs.gw.prevhash_switch_timeout: Verdict did not arrive within prevhash_verdict_timeout_ms and stale hold expired
docs.gw.prevhash_verdict_rejected: Verifier rejected the prevhash template (inline mode gates it)
docs.gw.template_cache_miss: Template referenced by share not found in LRU cache
docs.gw.stale_job_submission: Share referenced a job_id from a superseded template
docs.gw.share_replay_detected: share_id already seen in dedup window
docs.gw.share_difficulty_below_target: Share hash did not meet channel difficulty
docs.gw.share_invalid_job_id: job_id not in active job table
docs.gw.version_bit_violation: version_bits outside BIP320 general purpose mask
docs.gw.share_forward_failed: HTTP POST to share upstream failed (transport)
docs.gw.share_dropped_queue_full: Forward queue at capacity, share dropped per policy
docs.gw.share_evicted_from_queue: Share evicted from queue under drop_old policy
docs.vr.avg_fee_below_minimum: Average fee per vByte below configured minimum
docs.vr.total_fees_below_minimum: Total coinbase rewards below policy threshold
docs.vr.coinbase_value_zero_rejected: Coinbase output value is zero and policy rejects it
docs.vr.prev_hash_len_mismatch: Previous block hash length does not match expected value
docs.vr.invalid_prev_hash: Previous block hash does not reference valid chain
docs.vr.protocol_version_mismatch: Block version or protocol level not supported
docs.vr.empty_template_rejected: Template contains no transactions and policy rejects it
docs.vr.policy_load_error: Verifier could not load or parse policy configuration
docs.vr.mempool_backend_unavailable: Connection to mempool data source lost or unavailable
docs.vr.weight_ratio_exceeded: Transaction weight exceeds allowed ratio to block size
docs.vr.coinbase_sigops_abnormal: Coinbase script sigops count is abnormally high
docs.sa.title: share_accepted
docs.sa.desc: Emitted immediately when share is accepted by gateway. One event per valid share submission.
docs.sa.share_id: Proof-of-work deduplication key; stable identifier for this share
docs.sa.event_id: Event attribution and integrity key; joins share_accepted to share_forward_result
docs.sa.channel_id: SV2 channel ID assigned to this miner connection
docs.sa.job_id: Job ID from active template cache
docs.sa.worker_id: Authenticated worker identity from SV2 connection
docs.sa.sv2_response: Whether share was accepted (success) or rejected (error)
docs.sa.reason_code: Machine-readable code for the decision; present if sv2_response = "error"
docs.sa.difficulty_target: Channel difficulty at time of submission
docs.sa.timestamp_ms: Unix timestamp in milliseconds at gateway receipt
docs.sa.gateway_instance_id: Identifier for the gateway process handling this share
docs.sfr.title: share_forward_result
docs.sfr.desc: Emitted after upstream HTTP response is received (or timeout occurs). One event per share_accepted with sv2_response = "success".
docs.sfr.share_id: Same share_id from corresponding share_accepted event
docs.sfr.event_id: Same event_id from corresponding share_accepted; join key
docs.sfr.forwarded: Whether share was successfully transmitted to upstream (true = sent, false = queue dropped)
docs.sfr.upstream_accepted: Upstream accept field from JSON response; null if connection failed
docs.sfr.upstream_http_status: HTTP status code from upstream response; null if transport error
docs.sfr.upstream_error: Error message from upstream response; null if accepted or transport error
docs.sfr.reason_code: Gateway reason if forwarded=false (queue drop, timeout, etc.); null if forwarded=true
docs.sfr.timestamp_ms: Unix timestamp in milliseconds at result recording
docs.cfg.core.listen_addr: Socket address for inbound miner connections
docs.cfg.core.http_addr: Socket address for HTTP API and metrics (/gateway/events, /metrics)
docs.cfg.core.verifier_addr: TCP address of pool-verifier for template verdicts
docs.cfg.core.verifier_http_url: HTTP endpoint for verifier GET /status; defaults to http://verifier_addr/status
docs.cfg.core.upstream_url: URL of job server (template-manager or bitcoind RPC)
docs.cfg.noise.noise_key_file: Path to gateway's Noise static private key (32 bytes, hex encoded)
docs.cfg.noise.noise_cert_file: Path to gateway's certificate (for miner identity binding)
docs.cfg.noise.authority_public_key_file: Path to authorized public key for Noise handshake validation
docs.cfg.noise.http_api_key: API key for HTTP endpoints; if set, all requests must include X-API-Key header
docs.cfg.noise.http_tls_cert_file: Path to TLS certificate for HTTPS HTTP server
docs.cfg.noise.http_tls_key_file: Path to TLS private key for HTTPS HTTP server
docs.cfg.timing.upstream_health_timeout_: Timeout for upstream health check request
docs.cfg.timing.upstream_stale_max_ms: Maximum age of template before marking upstream unavailable
docs.cfg.timing.prevhash_verdict_timeout: Milliseconds to wait for verifier verdict on prevhash change
docs.cfg.timing.prevhash_stale_hold_ms: Milliseconds to hold stale job before disconnect on prevhash timeout
docs.cfg.timing.verifier_heartbeat_inter: Milliseconds between heartbeat messages to verifier
docs.cfg.timing.max_template_age_ms: Maximum age of cached template before VerdictReason: template_stale
docs.cfg.timing.template_cache_size: Maximum number of templates to retain in LRU cache
docs.cfg.timing.max_future_templates: Maximum number of unverified future templates allowed in-flight
docs.cfg.share.share_upstream_url: HTTP endpoint for share submissions (pool backend POST target)
docs.cfg.share.share_upstream_secret: HMAC-SHA256 secret for signing share POST requests
docs.cfg.share.share_upstream_retries: Number of retries on transient upstream failures
docs.cfg.share.share_forward_queue_size: Maximum pending shares in forward queue
docs.cfg.share.share_dedup_window_size: Deduplication window size (number of unique share_ids to track)
docs.cfg.share.initial_difficulty: Initial share difficulty for new channels
docs.cfg.share.share_upstream_submit_tim: Timeout for individual upstream share submission
docs.cfg.auth.auth_allowlist: Array of allowed worker identities (for allowlist mode)
docs.cfg.auth.auth_prefix_map: Map of identity prefixes to policies (for prefix_map mode)
docs.cfg.auth.max_worker_id_bytes: Maximum allowed length of worker identity string
docs.esc.VELDRA_ALLOW_DROP_OLD_INLINE: Allows drop_old share queue policy in inline mode (default: forbidden for safety)
docs.esc.VELDRA_ALLOW_NO_API_KEY: Allows http_addr to be exposed without http_api_key authentication (default: forbidden)
docs.esc.VELDRA_ALLOW_PLAINTEXT: Permits miner connections without Noise encryption (default: forbidden)
docs.esc.VELDRA_ALLOW_INSECURE_HTTP_UPST: Allows upstream_url to use http:// instead of https:// (default: forbidden)
docs.esc.VELDRA_ALLOW_NO_SHARE_UPSTREAM_: Permits inline mode when share upstream is not reachable at startup (default: forbidden)
docs.sec.is.title: What it is
docs.sec.is.1: A miner-facing gateway that verifies templates in real-time
docs.sec.is.2: Noise NX encrypted transport with certificate binding
docs.sec.is.3: Deterministic fail-closed prevhash switching with 50ms timeout
docs.sec.is.4: Machine-readable reason codes for every decision
docs.sec.is.5: Two-event share lifecycle with HMAC-SHA256 signing
docs.sec.isnot.title: What it is not
docs.sec.isnot.1: A pool backend or share accounting system
docs.sec.isnot.2: A replacement for upstream policy enforcement
docs.sec.isnot.3: A DDoS mitigation appliance (no rate limiting beyond peer quotas)
docs.sec.isnot.5: A substitute for operator vigilance and monitoring
docs.sec.ops.title: Operational guidance
docs.sec.ops.1: Always run in shadow mode first to establish trust
docs.sec.ops.2: Monitor verifier latency and uptime continuously
docs.sec.ops.4: Rotate http_api_key regularly and keep secure
docs.sec.ops.5: Use TLS for HTTP endpoints in production
docs.callout.join: 1:1 join invariant: Every share_accepted with sv2_response = "success" produces exactly one share_forward_result. The adapter blocks on channel capacity rather than dropping results.
docs.callout.critical: ⚠ Critical: Do not expose /gateway/events or /metrics to untrusted networks. Set http_api_key in production. Both endpoints require authentication to prevent information leakage.
observe.dash.mixed_content_warn: The API endpoint uses http:// but this page is served over https://. Browsers block mixed content requests. Use an https:// endpoint or access this page over http:// for local testing.
observe.dash.demo_desc: No live backend detected. Showing example data to illustrate the dashboard.
observe.policy.title: Active Policy Configuration
observe.arch.bitcoind_desc: Bitcoin Core node producing block templates via getblocktemplate
observe.arch.tmgr_desc: Packages raw templates into TemplatePropose with metadata
observe.arch.verifier_desc: Evaluates against policy.toml, emits TemplateVerdict with reason_code
observe.arch.dashboard_desc: Read-only analytics, verdict stream, and policy display
observe.tech.rust_desc: Memory-safe systems language with zero-cost abstractions. No garbage collector, no runtime overhead, no undefined behavior.
observe.tech.tokio_desc: Async runtime for concurrent TCP and HTTP handling. Non-blocking I/O across all connections with minimal resource usage.
observe.tech.axum_desc: Type-safe HTTP framework built on hyper and tower. Compile-time route validation with ergonomic extractors.
observe.tech.bitcoin_desc: Native getblocktemplate integration. NDJSON wire protocol for template proposals and verdicts over TCP.
observe.catalog.protocol_version_mismatc: Template protocol version does not match the version required by policy.
observe.catalog.invalid_prev_hash: Previous block hash contains non-hexadecimal characters.
observe.catalog.prev_hash_len_mismatch: Previous block hash length does not match required_prevhash_len.
observe.catalog.coinbase_value_zero_reje: Coinbase value is zero and reject_coinbase_zero flag is enabled.
observe.catalog.empty_template_rejected: Template has zero transactions and reject_empty_templates flag is enabled.
observe.catalog.tx_count_exceeded: Transaction count exceeds max_tx_count policy limit.
observe.catalog.total_fees_below_minimum: Total fees in the template fall below min_total_fees threshold.
observe.catalog.avg_fee_below_minimum: Average fee per transaction is below the tier-specific minimum threshold.
observe.catalog.policy_load_error: Policy configuration could not be loaded (lock poisoned or unavailable).
observe.catalog.mempool_backend_unavaila: Mempool data fetch failed; tier selection fell back to configured default.
observe.catalog.internal_error: Unexpected handler failure during template evaluation.
observe.catalog.weight_ratio_exceeded: Template weight as a fraction of MAX_BLOCK_WEIGHT (4,000,000 WU) exceeds the configured max_weight_ratio threshold.
observe.catalog.template_stale: Template age exceeds max_template_age_ms, indicating the template may be based on outdated chain state.
observe.catalog.sigops_budget_warning: Total sigops in the template exceed the configured warn_sigops_ratio of MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS (80,000). Observe-only by default.
observe.catalog.coinbase_sigops_abnormal: Coinbase transaction sigops exceed warn_coinbase_sigops_max, which may indicate an unusual or adversarial coinbase. Observe-only by default.
observe.flow.s1_desc: Bitcoin node produces a block template. Template Manager packages it as a TemplatePropose with block height, fees, and tx count.
observe.flow.s2_desc: Pool Verifier checks the template against policy.toml rules in sequence: protocol version, prev hash, fees, tx limits, tier thresholds, and consensus safety checks (weight ratio, template staleness, sigops budget).
observe.flow.s3_desc: A TemplateVerdict is returned with accepted/rejected status, canonical reason_code, human-readable detail, and policy context.
observe.flow.s4_desc: Every verdict is written to disk (NDJSON), kept in memory (last 1000), and exposed via HTTP for this dashboard to display.
docs.hero.label: Documentation
docs.section.config_sub: 51 TOML configuration keys across six categories. All values can be overridden by environment variables.
docs.section.events_sub: Two-event lifecycle: share_accepted on receipt, share_forward_result on upstream response.
docs.section.rc_sub: 34 machine-readable codes for every gateway decision. Filter by category below.
docs.section.verdict_sub: 15 verdicts emitted by the template verifier. Used in template_verdict events and gateway disconnects.
